title: [Large-Scale] Medical Simulation-Based Team Competency Enhancement Program: Fostering Social Interaction and Civic Consciousness

context.prior_knowledge: Basic medical knowledge, team collaboration experience, and foundational understanding of social interaction and civic awareness
context.additional_context: Utilizing Simulation Equipment and Virtual Patient Systems in a BYOD Environment. Conducting practical exercises after assigning roles to 5-6-member teams. Parallel case studies on medical ethics, respect for patient rights, and community health promotion

learning_goals: In simulation environments, perform low-level cognitive processes (information summarization, diagnostic review) with 80% accuracy during emergency medical response and apply effective communication strategies among team members.
Observe and record ≥3 instances of metacognitive processes (decision-making rationale, role adjustments) among team members, deriving conflict management and collaboration protocol improvements.
In debriefing sessions, propose two strategies to convert negative emotions (anxiety, frustration) into positive feedback and discuss methods to foster psychological safety within teams.
Achieve an average score of ≥3 out of 4 on simulation evaluation rubric criteria (leadership, technical proficiency, civic consciousness) and demonstrate social responsibility capabilities.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
